Mahashweta Patra

I received my B.Sc degree in Physics from Visa-Bharati University in 2012. I am a 6th year Integrated PhD student in IISER-Kolkata.

I am mainly interested in three dimensional piecewise smooth systems. Systems that are not smooth can undergo bifurcations that are forbidden in smooth systems, such as border collision bifurcations and robust chaos. I have also studied synchronization in periodic oscillators.

 Email ID: mp12ip005@iiserkol.ac.in

 More information available here




Soumyajit Seth

I obtained my Bachelors and Masters Degree in Physics from the University of Burdwan, West Bengal, India in 2012 and 2014 respectively. I joined as a guest faculty in the Electronics Department at Burdwan Raj College under the University of Burdwan in 2014. I am now pursuing research and Teaching Assistantship (TA) in different courses with the Department of Physical Sciences at IISER Kolkata. My work is funded by the INSPIRE Scholarship and INSPIRE Fellowship (given by DST).

My research involves investigating bifurcation phenomena in piecewise smooth systems experimentally. Currently, I am studying multiple attractor bifurcation phenomena, in a real electronic system that gives rise to a 2D piecewise smooth system.

 Email ID: ss14rs057@iiserkol.ac.in




Dhrubajyoti Mandal

My research interests lie in the dynamics of piecewise smooth maps. I have been awarded the CSIR-UGC NET Junior Research Fellowship and the IISER-Kolkata Institute Fellowship for pursuing my PhD.

 Email ID: dmandal93@gmail.com

 More information available here




Arnab Acharya

My research interests lie in complex network dynamics. I am presently working on applying complex networks techniques to study vulnerabilities of the Indian power grid. I previously worked on modeling stringed instruments as arrays of coupled oscillators.

 Email ID: aa14ip031@iiserkol.ac.in




Bichitra Kumar Lenka

My research interests lie in fractional order ordinary differential equations.
